trans-unit.source: Accessing Azure Active Directory Graph Information (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Accessing Azure Active Directory Graph Information (Windows Store) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to access Azure Active Directory information using the Graph API in your Windows Store application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to access Azure Active Directory information using the Graph API in your Windows Store application.

trans-unit.source: Accessing Azure Active Directory Graph Information
trans-unit.target: Accessing Azure Active Directory Graph Information

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Like the other identity providers offered with Mobile Services, the Azure Active Directory (AAD) provider also supports a rich Graph API which can be used for programmatic access to the directory.
trans-unit.target: Like the other identity providers offered with Mobile Services, the Azure Active Directory (AAD) provider also supports a rich Graph API which can be used for programmatic access to the directory.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you update the ToDoList app to personalize the authenticated user’s app experience returning additional user information you retrieve from the directory using the [Graph REST API].
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you update the ToDoList app to personalize the authenticated user’s app experience returning additional user information you retrieve from the directory using the [Graph REST API].

trans-unit.source: For more information on the Azure AD Graph API, see the [Azure Active Directory Graph Team Blog].
trans-unit.target: For more information on the Azure AD Graph API, see the [Azure Active Directory Graph Team Blog].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The intent of this tutorial is to extend your knowledge of authentication with the Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The intent of this tutorial is to extend your knowledge of authentication with the Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: It is expected that you have completed the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial using the Azure Active Directory authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: It is expected that you have completed the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial using the Azure Active Directory authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial continues to update the TodoItem application used in the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial continues to update the TodoItem application used in the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must have already completed these Mobile Services tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must have already completed these Mobile Services tutorials:

trans-unit.source: [Add Authentication to your app]
trans-unit.target: [Add Authentication to your app]

trans-unit.source: Adds a login requirement to the TodoList sample app.
trans-unit.target: Adds a login requirement to the TodoList sample app.

trans-unit.source: [Custom API Tutorial]
trans-unit.target: [Custom API Tutorial]

trans-unit.source: Demonstrates how to call a custom API.
trans-unit.target: Demonstrates how to call a custom API.

trans-unit.source: Generate an access key for the App registration in AAD
trans-unit.target: Generate an access key for the App registration in AAD

trans-unit.source: During the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial, you created a registration for the integrated application when you completed the [Register to use an Azure Active Directory Login] step.
trans-unit.target: During the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial, you created a registration for the integrated application when you completed the [Register to use an Azure Active Directory Login] step.

trans-unit.source: In this section you generate a key to be used when reading directory information with that integrated application's client ID.
trans-unit.target: In this section you generate a key to be used when reading directory information with that integrated application's client ID.

trans-unit.source: Create a GetUserInfo custom API
trans-unit.target: Create a GetUserInfo custom API

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will create the GetUserInfo custom API that will use the Azure AD Graph API to retrieve additional information about the user from the AAD.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will create the GetUserInfo custom API that will use the Azure AD Graph API to retrieve additional information about the user from the AAD.

trans-unit.source: If you've never used custom APIs with Mobile Services, refer to the [Custom API Tutorial] before completing this section.
trans-unit.target: If you've never used custom APIs with Mobile Services, refer to the [Custom API Tutorial] before completing this section.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right click mobile service .NET backend project and click **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right click mobile service .NET backend project and click **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: In the NuGet Package Manager dialog, enter **ADAL** in the search criteria to find and install the **Active Directory Authentication Library** for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the NuGet Package Manager dialog, enter **ADAL** in the search criteria to find and install the **Active Directory Authentication Library** for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial was most recently tested with the 3.3.205061641-alpha (Prerelease) version of the ADAL package.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial was most recently tested with the 3.3.205061641-alpha (Prerelease) version of the ADAL package.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right click the **Controllers** folder for the mobile service project and click **Add** to add a new **Microsoft Azure Mobile Services Custom Controller** named `GetUserInfoController`.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right click the **Controllers** folder for the mobile service project and click **Add** to add a new **Microsoft Azure Mobile Services Custom Controller** named `GetUserInfoController`.

trans-unit.source: The client will call this API to get user information from the Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The client will call this API to get user information from the Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: In the new GetUserInfoController.cs file, add the following `using` statements.
trans-unit.target: In the new GetUserInfoController.cs file, add the following `using` statements.

trans-unit.source: In the new GetUserInfoController.cs file, add the following `UserInfo` class to hold the information we want to gather from the AAD.
trans-unit.target: In the new GetUserInfoController.cs file, add the following `UserInfo` class to hold the information we want to gather from the AAD.

trans-unit.source: In GetUserInfoController.cs, add the following member variables to the `GetUserInfoController` class.
trans-unit.target: In GetUserInfoController.cs, add the following member variables to the `GetUserInfoController` class.

trans-unit.source: In GetUserInfoController.cs, add the following `GetAADToken` method to the class.
trans-unit.target: In GetUserInfoController.cs, add the following `GetAADToken` method to the class.

trans-unit.source: This method uses the app settings you configured on the mobile service in the [Azure Management Portal] to get a token to access the Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This method uses the app settings you configured on the mobile service in the [Azure Management Portal] to get a token to access the Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: In GetUserInfoController.cs, add the following `GetAADUser` method to the class.
trans-unit.target: In GetUserInfoController.cs, add the following `GetAADUser` method to the class.

trans-unit.source: This method gets the Active Directory object id for the authorized user and then uses the Graph REST API to get the user's information from the Active Diretory.
trans-unit.target: This method gets the Active Directory object id for the authorized user and then uses the Graph REST API to get the user's information from the Active Diretory.

trans-unit.source: In GetUserInfoController.cs replace the `Get` method with the following method.
trans-unit.target: In GetUserInfoController.cs replace the `Get` method with the following method.

trans-unit.source: This method returns the user entity from the Azure Active directory using the Graph REST API and requires an authorized user to call the API.
trans-unit.target: This method returns the user entity from the Azure Active directory using the Graph REST API and requires an authorized user to call the API.

trans-unit.source: Save your changes and build the the service to verify no syntax errors.
trans-unit.target: Save your changes and build the the service to verify no syntax errors.

trans-unit.source: Publish the mobile service project to your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Publish the mobile service project to your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: Update the app to use GetUserInfo
trans-unit.target: Update the app to use GetUserInfo

trans-unit.source: In this section you will update the `AuthenticateAsync` method you implemented in the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial to call the custom API and return additional information about the user from the AAD.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will update the `AuthenticateAsync` method you implemented in the [Add Authentication to your app] tutorial to call the custom API and return additional information about the user from the AAD.

trans-unit.source: Test the app
trans-unit.target: Test the app

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, [Role based access control with the AAD in Mobile Services], you will use role based access control with the Azure Active Directory (AAD) to check group membership before allowing access.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, [Role based access control with the AAD in Mobile Services], you will use role based access control with the Azure Active Directory (AAD) to check group membership before allowing access.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
